hypothesis_content.title: Post-Liquidity-Crash Volatility Compression Break
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a market-wide liquidity crash event (like Oct '24), a subsequent period of extreme volatility compression (BTC 10-day realized volatility < 20-day realized volatility by >40%) will resolve with a directional move >5% within 5 days. The direction will be opposite the initial crash if in a NEUTRAL regime, or continuation if in a BEAR regime.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Liquidity crashes shake out weak hands and compress volatility. Post-crash, periods of extreme compression are unstable and tend to resolve sharply. The regime determines if it's a bear market continuation or a relief rally/counter-trend move.
entry_conditions: Market condition: 15 days after a >15% market-wide drawdown (liquidity crash)
BTC 10-day realized volatility < 60% of 20-day realized volatility
Bollinger Band (20,2) width on daily chart is at 30-day low
Regime is NEUTRAL or BEAR (as per FjordHQ classifier)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price moves 5% from entry in either direction (directional bet placed after break of compression range)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: N/A (entered on break of compression range high/low)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 60% of such compression periods resolve with continued sideways action (<3% move) instead of a >5% directional break.
